subject: Re: [junit] passing arguments to TestRunner?
msgSnippet: According to the FAQ: How do I run setup code once for all my TestCases? Wrap the top level suite in a subclass of TestSetup. Here is a sample AllTests.suite()
messageBody:
According to the FAQ:
How do I run setup code once for all my TestCases?
Wrap the top level suite in a subclass of TestSetup. Here is a sample
AllTests.suite() method:
public static Test suite() {
TestSuite suite= new TestSuite();
...add your tests and suites here...
TestSetup wrapper= new TestSetup(suite) {
public void setUp() {
oneTimeSetUp();
}
};
return wrapper;
}

From: "Andy Kriger" <akriger@...>

Subject: [junit] passing arguments to TestRunner?


> I'm new to using JUnit and starting setting up tests for a parser.
>
> I want to load a text file that contains data to test. Currently, I have
> static ArrayLists in my TestCase class. In the setUp method, I check if
> those ArrayLists are null, and if they are, load the test data. So, I only
> load the test data once but it seems messy to have test data loaded for
the
> whole suite in a method intended to setup a single test method. I guess
this
> data loading can be moved to the suite() method?
>
> However, I still have to hardcode the name of the data file. The TestCase
> class has a main method and I tried passing the test file name as an
> argument to that however that simply runs TestRunner which creates a new
> instance of the TestCase and undoes my data loading. Is there a way to
pass
> the name of the data file as an argument to TestRunner so it can be loaded
> when TestRunner calls suite()?
>
> If not, I guess I'm looking for a setUp method for suites as well as test
> methods.
>
> thx for any help
